title: Kicking off 2025
content:
Kickoff journal Ship log: what I changed, what I learned, and what I broke along the way. This covers design choices, constraints, trade-offs, and the small experiments that make the big picture hang together.

Kickoff journal Process: how the system is hosted, how I deploy, how I back up, and how I monitor whether things still run when I am asleep. Lots of pragmatic notes for future me.

Kickoff journal Momentum: a set of habits that keep me shipping. Routines for planning, writing, and measuring progress without getting stuck in perfecting the tooling.

Kickoff journal Story: context on why I picked this stack, how it fits into the rest of my projects, and what I am optimizing for when time is scarce.

Kickoff journal Tactics: the tiny, repeatable moves that accumulate into progress. Checklists, scripts, and templates that reduce friction so I can focus on the next experiment.

Kickoff journal Reflection: what went well, what I would redo, and the next iteration I am lining up. Honest notes about surprises, risks, and mitigations.

Kickoff journal Delivery: decisions about scope, quality bars, and when to call something done. Balancing the urge to keep polishing with the need to ship and learn.

Kickoff journal Impact: how changes affect users, my own workflow, and the operational load. Making sure every tweak earns its keep and is easy to revert if needed.

Kickoff journal Cadence: how often I publish, how I manage drafts, and how I keep the content useful for future readers who discover it out of order.

Kickoff journal Practical notes: links to tools, commands I re-run, and the numbers that tell me whether the experiment worked. Less fluff, more utility.
